text: Jorge Peláez Sánchez (born 29 September 1996), commonly known as Canillas, is a Spanish professional footballer who plays for Austrian club SV Ried as a forward. ==Club career== Born in Málaga, Canillas represented Málaga CF, CD Tirro Pichon, Atlético Madrid and Granada CF as a youth. On 29 November 2014, he made his senior debut for Granada CF B, coming on as a substitute for Gabriel Corozo in a 1–0 defeat against Sevilla Atlético. On 23 July 2015, he signed a three-year contract extension with the club. On 1 September 2016, he was loaned out to Linares Deportivo. On 9 January 2017, he left Linares Deportivo. On the next day, his contract was terminated by mutual consent. Canillas switched to UCAM Murcia CF B on 31 January 2017. After a stint with Écija Balompié, he moved abroad and joined Austrian club FC Blau-Weiß Linz on 7 June 2018. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="3"|Granada B |2014–15 |Segunda División B |1||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||1||0 |- |2015–16 |Segunda División B |1||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||1||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !2!!0!!colspan="2"|—!!colspan="2"|—!!2!!0 |- |rowspan="1"|Linares Deportivo (loan) |2016–17 |Segunda División B |10||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||10||0 |- |UCAM Murcia B |2016–17 |Tercera División |15||10||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||15||10 |- |Écija |2017–18 |Segunda División B |21||2||0||0||colspan="2"|—||21||2 |- |Blau-Weiß Linz |2018–19 |Erste Liga |5||1||0||0||colspan="2"|—||5||1 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !48!!13!!0!!0!!0!!0!!48!!13 |} ==References== ==External links== * * * * Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Association football forwards Category:Spanish footballers Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:Club Recreativo Granada players Category:UCAM Murcia CF B players Category:Écija Balompié players Category:Austrian Football Second League players Category:FC Blau-Weiß Linz players Category:SV Ried players Category:Spanish expatriate footballers Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in Austria Category:Expatriate footballers in Austria
